text: Emma Hooper is a Canadian writer."How a move to England helped Emma Hooper write about Saskatchewan". The Globe and Mail, February 22, 2015. She is most notable for her 2018 novel Our Homesick Songs, which was named as a longlisted nominee for the 2018 Scotiabank Giller Prize."Esi Edugyan, Patrick deWitt, Tanya Tagaq among 12 authors longlisted for 2018 Scotiabank Giller Prize". CBC Books, September 17, 2018. Born and raised in Alberta, Hooper moved to England in 2004 after completing her B.A. in music and writing at the University of Alberta. She completed an M.A. in creative writing at Bath Spa University before undertaking a Ph.D. in creative and critical writing at the University of East Anglia, which she completed in 2010. She subsequently taught at Bath Spa University. Her debut novel Etta and Otto and Russell and James was published in 2015,"Etta and Otto and Russell and James by Emma Hooper – fairytale friendships and the great outdoors". The Guardian, January 29, 2015. and was a shortlisted finalist for the amazon.ca First Novel Award. Our Homesick Songs followed in 2018."Emma Hooper's book about Newfoundland, Our Homesick Songs, is 'lovely and lyrical'".
